intro: Diplostephium micradenium, commonly known as the small-fruited diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and grasslands. Its leaves are usually narrow and alternate, while the flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
